posts.post_content:
My favorite wall of all time.
  
Yes direct damage can kill it and yes trample spills over the 2 toughness, but it only costs 2 and never goes away blocking , and has flying. Much better than it predecessors such as [Wall of Shadows](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Shadows), [Uncle Istvan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Uncle Istvan), and [Wall of Vapor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Vapor).
  
I'm excited to see [Guard Gomazoa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guard Gomazoa) in *Rize of Eldrazi*, costs a little more to get out but is a little tougher to kill with direct damage and stops a little more trample.
posts.html:

I'm excited to see Guard Gomazoa in Rize of Eldrazi, costs a little more to get out but is a little tougher to kill with direct damage and stops a little more trample.

posts.post_content:
Fog Bank - confusing dinosaurs since '98.  
  
It's a pretty good early drop, if anything it'll stop creatures for a few turns and if your opponent is frustrated by it enough they'll waste removal on it; sadly trample damage still goes through though. [Guard Gomazoa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guard Gomazoa) outclasses it a bit, but for one less mana it's still a pain for your opponent to deal with.

Posted By: Laguz (8/31/2009 8:47:32 AM)

posts.post_content:
For trample you must only assign lethal damage, not deal it. Comprehensive rule 702.17b. "...Once all those blocking creatures are assigned lethal damage, any remaining damage is assigned as its controller chooses among those blocking creatures and the player..."  
  
Example: A 6/6 green creature with trample is blocked by a 2/2 creature with protection from green. The attacking creature’s controller must assign at least 2 damage to the blocker, even though that damage will be prevented by the blocker’s protection ability.
posts.html:
For trample you must only assign lethal damage, not deal it. Comprehensive rule 702.17b. "...Once all those blocking creatures are assigned lethal damage, any remaining damage is assigned as its controller chooses among those blocking creatures and the player..."

Example: A 6/6 green creature with trample is blocked by a 2/2 creature with protection from green. The attacking creature’s controller must assign at least 2 damage to the blocker, even though that damage will be prevented by the blocker’s protection ability.
